result.execSummary:
The defendant Abu Boikai S Bruce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Abu Boikai S Bruce is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Abu Boikai S Bruce was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 08-18-15 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abu Boikai S Bruce

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Abu Boikai S Bruce in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Abu Boikai S Bruce in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing proceeded.  

Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-18-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Abu Boikai S Bruce in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Abu Boikai S Bruce in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Abu Boikai S Bruce in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
